title-group.article-title: AN IMPROVED UPPER BOUND FOR THE ARGUMENT OF THE RIEMANN ZETA-FUNCTION ON THE CRITICAL LINE

abstract.p: This paper concerns the function S(t), the argument of the Riemann zeta-function along the critical line. Improving on the method of Backlund, and taking into account the refinements of Rosser and McCurley it is proved that for sufficiently large t, ǀS(t)ǀ ≤ 0.1013 log t. Theorem 2 makes the above result explicit, viz. it enables one to select values of a and b such that, for t > t 0 , ǀS(t)ǀ ≤ a + b log t.
